publications.title: NeuroWizard: Investigating the Effect of Gamification on BCI Performance among Adult Users with ADHD
publications.abstract: Brain-Computer Interfaces (BCI) are systems that allow users to transmit commands to computers using brain activity. This study explored how individuals with ADHD interacted with a gamified BCI task compared to a non-gamified standard one. Results indicated that the Gamified environment scored higher on Sensory and Imaginative Immersion while scoring lower on Negative Affect.

publications.title: BCHJam: a Brain-Computer Music Interface for Live Music Performance in Shared Mixed Reality Environments
publications.abstract: We present BCHJam: an IoMusT-based performance ecosystem composed of performers, audience members, brain-computer interfaces, smart musical instruments, and mixed reality headsets. The BCMI signal controls mixed reality visual effects displayed in XR headsets worn by audience members.

publications.title: Hybrid Harmony: A Multi-Person Neurofeedback Application for Interpersonal Synchrony
publications.abstract: Recent years have seen a dramatic increase in studies measuring brain activity, physiological responses, and/or movement data from multiple individuals during social interaction. So-called 'hyperscanning' research has demonstrated that brain activity may become synchronized across people as a function of various factors.

publications.title: Music-Emotion: Towards real-time recognition of affective states using a wearable Brain-Computer Interface
publications.abstract: This research investigates the feasibility of performing Emotion-Recognition using Melomind, a wearable neural interface. EEG signals are processed using machine learning algorithms for classification of emotional dimensions of valence and arousal.

publications.title: AR Notes: Augmenting Collaborative Tools
publications.abstract: Over decades of HCI research, humans interact more naturally with tangible interfaces recalling familiar functionalities. This work explores integrating tangibles and software in augmented reality collaborative environments.
